summary: The future of the movie theater industry may seem bleak in the U.S., as audiences are slow to return to cinemas and blockbuster features get postponed into 2021, but director Ron Howard doesn't think this 100-year-old business is going away.
headline: Ron Howard: The movie theater industry is 'not going away'

summary: "This has got to be a huge wakeup call for the NFL," sports agent Drew Rosenhaus told CNBC. "This could happen to any team, any week."
headline: Sports agent Drew Rosenhaus: 'I am very worried' about NFL season after Titans coronavirus cases
Facebook will push more users to discover and join groups
summary: Facebook on Thursday announced several new features for groups, including new ways the service will recommend public groups to users.

headline: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Bed Bath & Beyond, Overstock, Papa John's & more
Nearly 3 in 10 Native American women work a front-line job, but they're far from receiving equal pay
summary: Native American women, on average, are paid approximately $0.60 for every dollar earned by White, non-Hispanic men.

headline: How much your Social Security check will be if you make $60,000 per year
summary: Saving enough money for retirement can be tough. Luckily, you should have some help from Social Security. Here's how much you can expect if you earn $60,000 per year.
Boeing is planning to consolidate production of its 787 Dreamliner planes at it's facility in North Charleston, South Carolina, a blow to its manufacturing center in Puget Sound.
headline: Boeing will consolidate Dreamliner production in South Carolina as demand drops

summary: San Antonio-based Xenex makes the $125,000 robots that help eliminate viruses on surfaces in minutes.
headline: The Carolina Panthers will use a $125,000 virus-killing robot in their stadium as fans return with Covid-19 restrictions
Toxic workplaces are everywhere, but minimum wage workers know them well
summary: "There are differing levels of toxic workplaces. To me, Ellen DeGeneres doesn't define toxic workplaces."

headline: Spice Girl Melanie C says the live music industry needs support
summary: Spice Girl Melanie Chisholm, aka Mel C or Sporty Spice, has told CNBC that the live music industry has been "hit so hard" by the coronavirus pandemic and needs support.

headline: A new technology skill every worker needs to be more valuable: Former Goldman Sachs CFO
summary: The idea that coders will dominate the future of the job market is wrong, but all workers need to learn some coding if they want a successful career, says former Goldman Sachs CFO Martin Chavez.

headline: Senate committee votes to subpoena CEOs of Facebook, Google and Twitter to testify
summary: The Senate Commerce Committee Thursday voted on a bipartisan basis to subpoena the CEOs of Facebook, Google and Twitter to testify.

headline: Saudi Crude Exports Surge to Four-Month High in September - Bloomberg
Hims, a direct-to-consumer health company, is going public via SPAC
summary: The company, which operates both men's and women's health brands and is sometimes called Hims & Hers, is merging with a special purpose acquisition company (SPAC) sponsored by investment management firm Oaktree Capital Management.
After completing it Covid-19 bubble in Canada, NHL Chief Business Officer Keith Wachtel tells CNBC the league hopes to have its virtual advertisement technology for the 2021-22 season.
headline: After bubble experiment, NHL turns to new ad tech to make up for missed revenue due to coronavirus

summary: Microsoft on Thursday announced a new affordable laptop, the Surface Laptop Go, which starts at $549.

headline: Patrick Mahomes agrees to equity deal with performance tech company Hyperice
summary: The Kansas Chiefs quarterback will also be a brand ambassador for the fitness tech company to help expand global brand exposure.

headline: Big Tech stocks close out a 'nightmare' September
summary: September has been a tough month for traders overall, but a perfect storm left big tech stocks, a sector that normally leads the market, with losses.

headline: Volatile September likely to be followed by rocky October as investors grapple with several risks
summary: If you think September was confusing, October is not likely to be any better, and it could be significantly rockier.

headline: After FedEx and UPS’ best quarter in decades, traders are backing transports
summary: FedEx stock closed the third quarter nearly 80% higher, and UPS ended 50% higher.
